articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An overnight Russian combined missile and drone attack triggered fires, smashed buildings and buried residents under rubble in the Ukrainian capital Kyiv, killing nine people and injuring more than 70, the State Emergency Service said on Thursday.
articles.title: Drone, missile attack on Kyiv kills nine, injures more than 70, says State Emergency Service

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: India has summoned the top Pakistani diplomat in New Delhi, local media reported on Thursday, a day after it announced measures to downgrade ties with Islamabad as relations between the nuclear-armed rivals plummeted following a deadly militant attack in Kashmir.
articles.title: India calls all-party meet, summons top Pakistani diplomat after Kashmir attack on tourists

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A high school student was killed and three others were injured in a knife attack at a school in the western French city of Nantes on Thursday before the assailant was overpowered by teachers, police said.
articles.title: Student killed in stabbing at French school, police say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Israeli airstrike hit a police station in Jabalia in the northern Gaza Strip on Thursday, killing at least 10 people, local health authorities said, and Israel's military said it had struck a command centre of Hamas and the Islamic Jihad groups.
articles.title: Israeli fire kills at least 26 people in Gaza, hits a police station

articles.author: Mike Stone, Pesha Magid
articles.description: Sources say the proposal was being lined up for announcement during  Trump's visit to the kingdom in May.
articles.title: Exclusive: Trump poised to offer Saudi Arabia over $100 billion arms package, sources say

articles.author: Joshua McElwee, Giulia Segreti
articles.description: Mourners stood in line for hours on Thursday to pay their final respects to Pope Francis, whose body is lying in state in St. Peter's Basilica ahead of his funeral on Saturday.
articles.title: Crowds wait for hours to pay final respects to Pope Francis at St. Peter's

articles.author: Philip Pullella
articles.description: Cardinals in meetings ahead of the start of a secret conclave to elect a successor to Pope Francis are scratching the hair under their red skull caps as they try to decide whether a cardinal convicted of embezzlement and fraud can join in the vote.
articles.title: Convicted cardinal wants to vote for pope, his brother prelates must decide

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: The U.S. Federal Aviation Administration said on Wednesday it had upgraded Thailand's air safety rating to "Category 1" a decade after a downgrade, paving the way for direct U.S.-Thailand flights to resume.
articles.title: US reinstates Thailand's top aviation safety rating

articles.author: Jeff Mason, Jarrett Renshaw
articles.description: President Donald Trump asserted on Thursday that trade talks between the U.S. and China are underway, pushing back against Chinese claims that no discussions have taken place to ease the ongoing trade war.
articles.title: Trump refutes China's claim of no trade talks

articles.author: Brendan Pierson
articles.description: A U.S. judge on Thursday blocked parts of President Donald Trump's executive order seeking to impose new rules on federal elections, which Democrats and other groups said risked denying eligible citizens the right to vote.
articles.title: Judge partly blocks Trump order imposing new rules on US elections
